intro: Galium verum var. brachycarpum, commonly known as lesser bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features slender, ascending stems that are often hairy and bear small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers, which are typical of the Rubiaceae family. Its flowers are followed by small, three-lobed fruits that are characteristic of the species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
